aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects

Class Asteroid

  • java.lang.Object
    • aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.GameObject
      • aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.Asteroid

  • public class Asteroid
extends GameObject
    An asteroid is a game object that needs to be destroyed in order to increase the score of the player. Destroying an asteroid is done by making it collide with another non asteroid game object, i.e. shooting it or flying into it. Note that flying into it, also destroys the spaceship, which will end the game.
    Author:
    Yannick Stoffers

      Asteroid(java.awt.geom.Point2D location, double velocityX, double velocityY, int radius, double rotation)
      Constructs a new asteroid at the specified location, with specified velocities in both X and Y direction and the specified radius.

      • Asteroid

        public Asteroid(java.awt.geom.Point2D location,
        double velocityX,
        double velocityY,
        int radius,
        double rotation)
        Constructs a new asteroid at the specified location, with specified velocities in both X and Y direction and the specified radius.
        Parameters:
        location - the location in which to spawn an asteroid.
        velocityX - the velocity in X direction.
        velocityY - the velocity in Y direction.
        radius - radius of the asteroid.
